descriptions.description: Developer turnover reduces the core developer stock as experienced members leave the project.
The skill up flow increases the new contributor stock by transitioning individuals from the onboarding pool.
The skill up flow increases the experienced contributor stock by advancing capable new contributors.
The promotion rate flow increases the experienced contributor stock by recognizing and advancing skilled members.
The promotion rate flow increases the core developer stock by elevating qualified experienced contributors.
Implicit knowledge transfer accelerates the skill up flow by providing direct mentorship and guidance.
Implicit knowledge transfer increases the promotion rate by preparing contributors for more advanced roles.
More core developers increase implicit knowledge transfer capacity through greater mentorship availability.
Explicit knowledge transfer accelerates the skill up flow by providing accessible learning materials and guides.
A larger pool of potential recruits increases the new contributor stock through successful onboarding.
A larger new contributor stock increases the skill up flow as more individuals undergo training.
A larger core developer stock can increase turnover due to burnout or career progression.
A larger experienced contributor stock increases the promotion rate by providing a larger candidate pool.
